@jipanyang How about a port need to attach vlan 1 and other vlans (trunk port)? 
Wouldn't the port be detached from vlan1 when attach to other vlans.  I think port should be move out of default vlan only when the first time to join `bridge` but not each time of attaching to vlans.

> Could you separate this pull request into two different pull requests? They are serving different purposes.
> Also, changing the CIR/CBS of the current policer might change the current image's behavior and stability. At least it will break the current tests which might not be desired at this moment.

As suggested, I moved the ip2me policer changes to a different PR https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/pull/1000

latestReviews.body: I'll check if the current vendor's SAI implementations support this or not before merging it. Thanks for the update!

reviews.body:
Could you separate this pull request into two different pull requests? They are serving different purposes.
Also,  changing the CIR/CBS of the current policer might change the current image's behavior and stability. At least it will break the current tests which might not be desired at this moment.
I'll check if the current vendor's SAI implementations support this or not before merging it. Thanks for the update!

comments.body: Changes looks good to me. Minor comments!

sometimes, the kernel driver package is splitted in base module and extra module packages, and team driver is in the extra package, and extra packet is not automatically installed. then, all lag related vs test will not pass. It is hard to debug that, therefore I am adding explicit check for this requirement.
this happened on the worker-2, after I manually installed extra kernel module, everything works.
yes, we want to have that control, but sometime, the server automatically upgrading their kernel controlled by azure. we need to disable it, but it is a separate issue.

latestReviews.body: wondering do we want to have a controlled or defined environment setup for the server

reviews.body: why explicitly check the 'team' module? what scenario did you encounter that is caused by this issue?
wondering do we want to have a controlled or defined environment setup for the server

comments.body:
https://sonic-jenkins.westus2.cloudapp.azure.com/job/vs/job/sonic-swss-build/test_results_analyzer/

to have a better view in the test results analyzer, all the tests need to be put into separated class objects. otherwise, they will be put under (root) directory.
I ran multiple tests, I suspect there is some genuine issue in the refactoring.

test_warm_reboot.py::TestWarmReboot::test_system_warmreboot_neighbor_syncup FAILED

this test failed constantly others are fine
i'll check this test

All checks have passed
2 successful checks
https://sonic-jenkins.westus2.cloudapp.azure.com/job/vs/job/sonic-swss-build-pr/406/
i'll try some more

reviews.body: do not merge yet, I found the refactor make the test more unstable.

comments.body: There is some idea to enable port one by one once the buffer profile is configured on it. Just make the current logic approach clear. https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/pull/990#issuecomment-514376154

comments.body:
```
Jul  3 18:46:22.656607 str-s6100-acs-5 ERR swss#orchagent: :- validateAddMatch: MIRROR_ACTION match is not supported for the table of type MIRROR_DSCP
```
this above message shall not appear since MIRROR_ACTION is not a match action.
#906 is missing; it is cherry-picked later

Hi, 
could you help in explaining if Warm-reboot for Policer is supported and how? 
create_policer(  &policer_id, gSwitchId, (uint32_t)attrs.size(), attrs.data()) 
there could be two differnet policer_id with same attribute.

@jangidrk yes; but that's fine; we will assign back the policers based on which other objects they are attached to; if they are two stand-alone policers with purely same attributes; they will be assigned back randomly after warm reboot.
